only those taken upon 
one and the same photo-
graphic plate can be 
directly compared as regards 
magnitude. On this sup-
position each plate would 
require its own scale of 
star magnitude to be drawn 
by correlating the stars upon 
it with each other and with 
eye photometric meas-
urements, and in order to 
make the scale applicable 
to any other plate, link stars 
determined photometrically 
would have to be found 
on the plates to be compared,
and errors eliminated by
